title: Awards annuity to recipients of purple heart medals
summary: Awards annuity to recipients of purple heart medals, who are identified as recipients under executive order 11016 and are New York state residents, annually for the amount of one thousand dollars.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the executive law, in relation to awarding an annual
         annuity to recipients of purple heart medals

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-

    1    Section 1. The executive law is amended by adding a new section 369 to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S  369.    PAYMENT  TO  RECIPIENTS OF PURPLE HEART MEDALS.  1. ANNUITY
    4  ESTABLISHED.   (A) A RECIPIENT OF  A  PURPLE  HEART  (AUTHORIZED  TO  BE
    5  AWARDED  PURSUANT  TO  EXECUTIVE ORDER 11016), SHALL UPON APPLICATION TO
    6  THE STATE DIRECTOR, BE PAID AN ANNUAL ANNUITY OUT OF THE TREASURY OF THE
    7  STATE FOR THE SUM OF ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR SUCH TERM AS SUCH  RECIPI-
    8  ENT SHALL BE ENTITLED THERETO UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE.
    9    (B)  THE  ENTITLEMENT  OF  ANY  RECIPIENT  OF  A PURPLE HEART MEDAL TO
   10  RECEIVE THE ANNUITY HEREIN PROVIDED SHALL  TERMINATE  UPON  HIS  OR  HER
   11  DEATH  OR UPON HIS OR HER CEASING TO CONTINUE TO BE A RESIDENT AND DOMI-
   12  CILED IN THE STATE OF NEW YORK, BUT SUCH ENTITLEMENT MAY  BE  REINSTATED
   13  UPON  APPLICATION  TO THE STATE DIRECTOR, IF SUCH RECIPIENT SHALL THERE-
   14  AFTER RESUME HIS OR HER RESIDENCE AND DOMICILE OF THE STATE.
   15    (C) THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF AN AWARD OF THE ANNUITY TO A RECIPIENT OF  A
   16  PURPLE HEART MEDAL SHALL BE THE DAY AFTER THE AWARDING OF A PURPLE HEART
   17  MEDAL  IF  THE APPLICATION THEREFOR IS RECEIVED WITHIN ONE YEAR FROM THE
   18  DATE OF AWARDING THE PURPLE HEART MEDAL.  IF THE APPLICATION IS RECEIVED
   19  AFTER THE EXPIRATION OF THE FIRST YEAR FOLLOWING THE DATE OF THE  AWARD-
   20  ING  OF  THE  PURPLE  HEART MEDAL, THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF AN AWARD OF THE
   21  ANNUITY TO A RECIPIENT OF A PURPLE HEART MEDAL  SHALL  BE  THE  DATE  OF
   22  RECEIPT  OF THE APPLICATION BY THE STATE DIRECTOR. IF THE APPLICATION IS
   23  DENIED BUT IS GRANTED AT A LATER DATE UPON AN APPLICATION FOR  RECONSID-

    1  ERATION  BASED UPON NEW EVIDENCE, THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE AWARD OF THE

    3  RECEIPT OF THE APPLICATION FOR RECONSIDERATION BY THE STATE DIRECTOR.
    4    (D)  ANY  APPLICANT  CONVICTED  OF  MAKING  ANY FALSE STATEMENT IN THE
    5  APPLICATION FOR THE ANNUITY SHALL BE SUBJECT TO PENALTIES PRESCRIBED  IN
    6  THE PENAL LAW.
    7    2.  QUALIFICATIONS. (A) ANY RECIPIENT OF A PURPLE HEART MEDAL (AUTHOR-
    8  IZED TO BE AWARDED PURSUANT TO EXECUTIVE ORDER 11016), WHO IS A RESIDENT
    9  OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, SHALL MAKE APPLICATION TO THE DIVISION.
   10    (B) NO ENTITLEMENT SHALL BE PAID UNDER THIS SECTION TO OR FOR A RECIP-
   11  IENT OF A PURPLE HEART MEDAL WHO IS IN PRISON IN A  FEDERAL,  STATE,  OR
   12  LOCAL  PENAL INSTITUTION AS A RESULT OF CONVICTION OF A FELONY OR MISDE-
   13  MEANOR FOR ANY PART OF THE PERIOD BEGINNING SIXTY-ONE DAYS AFTER HIS  OR
   14  HER IMPRISONMENT BEGINS AND ENDING WITH HIS OR HER RELEASE.
   15    (C)  THE  DECISION OF THE DIRECTOR ON MATTERS REGARDING THE PAYMENT OF
   16  SUCH ANNUITY SHALL BE FINAL.
   17    3. METHOD OF PAYMENT. (A) EVIDENCE OF  THE  MILITARY  SERVICE  OF  THE
   18  RECIPIENT  FOR  EACH  CASE  SHALL  BE  FURNISHED  IN THE MANNER AND FORM
   19  PRESCRIBED BY THE STATE DIRECTOR.
   20    (B) UPON BEING SATISFIED THAT SUCH SERVICE WAS HONORABLE,  THAT  OTHER
   21  FACTS  AND  STATEMENTS  IN THE APPLICATION OF SUCH RECIPIENT OF A PURPLE
   22  HEART MEDAL ARE TRUE, THE STATE DIRECTOR  SHALL  CERTIFY  TO  THE  STATE
   23  COMPTROLLER THE NAME AND ADDRESS OF SUCH RECIPIENT.
   24    (C)  THEREAFTER,  THE  DEPARTMENT OF TAXATION AND FINANCE, THROUGH THE
   25  DIVISION OF FINANCE, ON THE AUDIT AND WARRANT OF THE COMPTROLLER,  SHALL
   26  PAY  SUCH RECIPIENT OF A PURPLE HEART MEDAL SUCH SUM AS IS AUTHORIZED BY
   27  THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION IN SEMI-ANNUAL INSTALLMENTS FOR  SO  LONG
   28  AS  SUCH  QUALIFIED  RECIPIENT  OF  A  PURPLE HEART MEDAL SHALL MEET THE
   29  REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION.
   30    4. REPORT. THE STATE DIRECTOR SHALL SUBMIT A REPORT TO  THE  GOVERNOR,
   31  THE CHAIR OF THE SENATE FINANCE COMMITTEE, AND THE CHAIR OF THE ASSEMBLY
   32  WAYS  AND  MEANS COMMITTEE NOT LATER THAN JANUARY FIFTEENTH OF EACH YEAR
   33  THIS SECTION IS IN EFFECT.  SUCH REPORT SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMIT-
   34  ED  TO  REGULATIONS  PROMULGATED  PURSUANT  TO  THIS  SECTION,   AND   A
   35  DESCRIPTION AND EVALUATION OF THE PROGRAM.
   36    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   37  it shall have become a law; provided rules and regulations necessary for
   38  the  implementation of this act on its effective date are authorized and
   39  directed to be made by the division of veterans' affairs  on  or  before
   40  such effective date.
